SEARCH
Package com.nathcat.peoplecat_server

Class Packet

java.lang.Object
com.nathcat.peoplecat_server.Packet
public class Packet extends Object

Class for creating data which can be sent / received by the server / client.

Author:
Nathan Baines

Specification

Byte countData typePurpose
4IntegerPacket type
1BooleanIf true, this is the last packet in the sequence, if false, there are more packets to come
4IntegerPayload length (in bytes)
Defined by payload lengthStringJSON string containing the request body

  • Field Details

    • TYPE_ERROR

      public static final int TYPE_ERROR

      Since version 1.0.0

      Description

      Used to signify that an error has occurred, the payload provides information about this error.

      Payload Format

           {
         "name": String,
         "msg": String
     }

      Response Format

      Should not reply to this packet.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_PING

      public static final int TYPE_PING

      Since version 1.0.0

      Description

      An empty packet

      Payload Format

      Empty payload

      Response Format

      Respond with another ping packet

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_AUTHENTICATE

      public static final int TYPE_AUTHENTICATE

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      A packet of this type will be interpreted as an authentication request.

      Payload Format

           {
         "username": String
         "password": String
     }

      Or you might wish to authenticate with an AuthCat cookie: 

           {
         "cookie-auth": String
     }

      Where the cookie-auth string is the value of the AuthCat-SSO cookie.

      Cookie auth is available from server version 4.1.0, in this version the authentication flow requires either cookie auth or normal auth to be specified, i.e. one or the other and not both. If the cookie-auth field is present, the server will not attempt normal credential authentication.

      However, from server version 4.1.1, the authentication flow is such that if cookie-auth is specified, the server will try cookie authentication, and upon failure will try credential authentication.

      Response Format

           {
         "ID": Int,
         "username": String,
         "display_name": String,
         "password": String,
         "time_created": Long,
         "pfp_path": String,
         "cover_pic_path": String
     }
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_CREATE_NEW_USER

      public static final int TYPE_CREATE_NEW_USER
      Deprecated.
      This will be delegated to AuthCat and no longer handled by PeopleCat

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      Creates a new user with the data specified in the payload.

      Payload format

           {
         "username": String,
         "password": String,
         "display_name", String
     }

      Response format

           {
         "ID": Int,
         "username": String,
         "display_name": String,
         "password": String,
         "time_created": Long,
         "pfp_path": String,
         "cover_pic_path": String
     }
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      Purpose

      Payload format

      None

      Response format

      None

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_GET_USER

      public static final int TYPE_GET_USER

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      Request user data from the database. Passwords will be removed from the response.

      Payload format

            {
          "ID": Int,
          "username": String,
          "display_name": String,
      }

      Only one parameter needs to be specified, if multiple are given the following rules are applied to determine which one is used:

      1. If ID is specified, search for the user with this ID.
      2. If ID is not specified, but username is specified, search for all users with a username which begins with the string given.
      3. If neither ID nor username is specified, then display_name must be specified, so search for all users with a display_name which begins with the string given.

      Response format

      If there is at least one user which meets the criteria, each packet in the sequence has the following format.

           {
         "ID": Int,
         "username": String,
         "display_name": String,
         "password": String,
         "time_created": Long,
         "pfp_path": String,
         "cover_pic_path": String
     }

      If there are no users which match, a packet with no payload is sent.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_GET_MESSAGE_QUEUE

      public static final int TYPE_GET_MESSAGE_QUEUE

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      Request a list of messages in a given chat. If this chat is encrypted then the messages received will be in their encrypted format.

      Payload format

           {
         "ChatID": Int
     }

      Response format

      Multiple packets will be sent, each containing one message in the following format, under TYPE_GET_MESSAGE_QUEUE:

           {
         "ChatID": Int,
         "Content" String,
         "SenderID": Int,
         "TimeSent": Long
     }
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_SEND_MESSAGE

      public static final int TYPE_SEND_MESSAGE

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      Send a message into a chat.

      Payload format

           {
         "ChatID": Int,
         "Content": String,
         "TimeSent": Long
     }

      Response format

      The server will issue a ping packet in response.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_NOTIFICATION_MESSAGE

      public static final int TYPE_NOTIFICATION_MESSAGE

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      This is to be sent from the server to the connected client applications, it tells the client that they have received a new message.

      Payload format

           {
         "title": String,
         "message": String,
         "ChatID": Int
     }

      Response format

      The client should is not expected to reply to this packet.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_JOIN_CHAT

      public static final int TYPE_JOIN_CHAT

      Since version 1.0.0

      Purpose

      This message indicates that a client wishes to join a chat.

      Payload format

           {
         "ChatID": Int,
         "JoinCode": String,
     }

      Response format

      The server will reply under the same packet type to indicate success, with the full information about the chat, or will reply with an error packet to indicate failure. 

           {
         "ChatID": Int,
         "Name": String,
         "KeyID": Int,
         "JoinCode": String
     }
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_CHANGE_PFP_PATH

      public static final int TYPE_CHANGE_PFP_PATH
      Deprecated.
      This will be delegated to AuthCat and no longer handled by PeopleCat

      Since version 1.1.0

      Purpose

      This indicates a request to change the profile picture of the currently authenticated user.

      Payload format

           {
         "NewPath": String
     }

      Note that "NewPath" should be either a full url to the profile picture image, or the string "null", indicating the default profile picture.

      Response format

      The server will either respond with a packet with an empty payload under the type TYPE_CHANGE_PFP_PATH to indicate success, or it will reply with an error packet to indicate failure.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final int TYPE_GET_ACTIVE_USER_COUNT

      Since version 2.1.0

      Purpose

      Get the number of users currently online

      Payload format

      No payload required

      Response format

      { "users-online": Int }

    • TYPE_NOTIFICATION_USER_ONLINE

      public static final int TYPE_NOTIFICATION_USER_ONLINE

      Since version 4.0.0

      Purpose

      Alerts the receiver that the specified user has just come online.

      Note that this should only ever be sent from the server to the client, the same as other notification packets.

      Payload format

           {
         "id": Integer,
         "username": String,
         "fullName": String,
         "pfpPath": String
     }

      Response format

      Should not respond to this packet.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_NOTIFICATION_USER_OFFLINE

      public static final int TYPE_NOTIFICATION_USER_OFFLINE

      Since version 4.0.0

      Purpose

      Alerts the receiver that the specified user has just gone offline.

      Note that this should only ever be sent from the server to the client, the same as other notification packets.

      Payload format

           {
         "id": Integer,
         "username": String,
         "fullName": String,
         "pfpPath": String
     }

      Response format

      Should not respond to this packet.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_GET_FRIENDS

      public static final int TYPE_GET_FRIENDS

      Since version 4.0.0

      Purpose

      Get a list of the currently authenticated user's friends.

      Payload format

      No payload is required for this request.

      Response format

      Server will reply with a sequence of packets specifying the basic information of the authenticated user's friends, each packet will contain one user.

      This is the same as the get user request response format, but will be under the get friends packet type.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_FRIEND_REQUEST

      public static final int TYPE_FRIEND_REQUEST

      Since version 4.0.0

      Purpose

      Manipulate a user's friend requests. This includes actions such as sending, and accepting / declining

      Note that the server will send a packet to the client under this type when a friend request is sent to the user that client is logged in as, such a packet will contain the following payload format detailing the information of the user that sent the request. 

           {
         "id": Integer
         "username": String
         "fullName": String
         "pfpPath": String
     }

      Payload format

      This packet type has a conditional payload, but must always contain the "action" field: 

           {
         "action": String -> "SEND", "ACCEPT", "DECLINE",
         IF "action" = "SEND" THEN:
         "recipient": Integer,
         OR IF "action" = "ACCEPT" OR "DECLINE" THEN:
         "id": Integer
         OR IF "action" = "GET" THEN NONE REQUIRED
     }

      Response format

      If "action" = "SEND" in the request, then the response is of this format: 

           {
         "id": Integer
     }

      If "action" = "GET", then a sequence of packets is supplied, each with the payload: 

           {
         "id": Integer,
         "sender": Integer
     }

      Otherwise, there is no response beside error messages.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE_GET_SERVER_INFO

      public static final int TYPE_GET_SERVER_INFO

      Since version 4.0.0

      Purpose

      Get information about the current version of the server

      Payload format

      No payload required

      Response format

           {
         "version": String,
         "server-time": String,
     }
      See Also:
